text: So the thought is that if you had a population somewhere (mars or something) with no common cold whatsoever and no one had ever had it, then introduced the common cold it'd interact with that population about the same as Covid19 is doing to us? <@U8JP5B9T2>

elements.text: So the thought is that if you had a population somewhere (mars or something) with no common cold whatsoever and no one had ever had it, then introduced the common cold it'd interact with that population about the same as Covid19 is doing to us?

text: Yeah, that's the hypothesis. Presumably, there are populations on earth without exposure (Madagascar, the Amazon etc), but the populations are small enough that a small percentage of deaths due to respiratory illness would hardly be remarked upon

elements.text: Yeah, that's the hypothesis. Presumably, there are populations on earth without exposure (Madagascar, the Amazon etc), but the populations are small enough that a small percentage of deaths due to respiratory illness would hardly be remarked upon

text: And obviously, we're not about to do that experiment (at least not intentionally)

elements.text: And obviously, we're not about to do that experiment (at least not intentionally)
